title: MANO Advocacy Meeting: Modernization of Ontario’s Film Classification Act, 2005
summary: MANO is looking for input from its membership around this subject. How does Ontario's Film Classification Act currently affect our sector? What are the priorities for the artist-run film exhibitors, distributors and producers in revisions to the Act? How should we voice our opinions and concerns effectively to the Ministry?

title: Vucavu Outreach: Marketing Film and Video in the Digital Age
summary: This VUCAVU OUTREACH presentation is led by Jacquelyn Hébert, VUCAVU’s Community and Program Manager, and is intended for artists and filmmakers interested in learning about distribution options available for their films and videos. During the session, Jacquelyn will discuss digital marketing for film and video, what VUCAVU.com is, what an independent distributor does and what we offer artists.

title: GDC Offsite × GDC Talks
summary: DMG and Gamma Space are teaming up to bring a little GDC here to Toronto, with talks by speakers from our community who were scheduled to present at the postponed conference, indoor park hangout chill zone, games at Friends Play Games, and snacks for all.

title: Friends Play Games
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Civic hacknight #232
summary: Come help chip away at civic problems by combining technology with the power of our community.

title: Civic hacknight #231
summary: Come help chip away at civic problems by combining technology with the power of our community.

title: Tabletop Game Night: Ryuutama
summary: Roll dice, make characters, face challenges and tell an awesome story in an evening of roleplaying.

title: BreakoutCon × DMG Queer Mixer
summary: Join DMG and BreakoutCon for a queer social with all your ttrpg buds, new and old!

title: Textile Game Controllers Game Jam
summary: How can electronic textile techniques be used to create bespoke, alternative game controllers? This game jam will provide participants with the opportunity and support to apply the skills introduced through the Textile Game Controller Workshop Series (2018-2020) to fully developed e-textile game controller prototypes.

title: Home Is A Place That Visits Me Book Launch
summary: Join UK-based artist Hannah Hull, one of the contributing artists in Trinity Square Video’s Architecture After the Asylum exhibition, to launch her new publication, Home Is Place That Visits Me.

title: Anti-Oppression and Inclusivity in the Arts
summary: Join co-facilitators Parul Pandya and Belinda Ageda for a workshop on anti-oppression and inclusivity principles and practices for arts workers. This training will be tailored to arts educators, programmers, administrators and anyone else involved in contributing to arts spaces and programs in the city.

title: Debrief Circle
summary: During this Debrief Circle, we will both hold space for debriefing difficult situations we have witnessed or been a part of within Toronto arts communities as well as learn how to debrief effectively.

title: Game Writers Circle + Social
summary: Join other game writers and narrative designers for a cozy get together every month!

title: Dying To Learn: A Mad Students Panel
summary: Presented alongside Rebecca Sweets' immersive exhibit (Love My Dysfunctions) on now in the CSV gallery, Margin of Eras Gallery presents a conversation between mad and neurodivergent students + former students on anti-sanism and anti-ableism in academia ranging from topics such as the institutionalization of sanism and ableism in academic policy and culture, internalized ableism and sanism in the academy, and imagining what a mad-positive university might look like.

title: GMing Club 05: Ryuutama Pt. 2
summary: For folks who have always wanted to run a tabletop RPG but needed a great group, a safe space, an easy way to learn the game, or just a little encouragement, Shel Kahn is running the GMing Club, a program to help folks who want to try being a Game Master to learn a new game.

title: Intro to the Texturing Pipeline
summary: Get a handle on the basics of the texturing pipeline with this introductory workshop for 3D artists!

title: An Introduction to Cannabis
summary: With hundreds of cannabis products available, how do you make an informed decision on what to consume? Join Tokyo Smoke 1180 Queen for an informational workshop covering a variety of bud-related topics for those new to cannabis.

title: Pin + Patch Show 2020
summary: Pin + Patch is back for its 4th annual show! Featuring over 50 pin and patch vendors from Toronto, across Canada, and around the world!

title: Being Scene Opening Reception
summary: Join Workman Arts for the opening reception of Being Scene 2020. View over 100 artworks and get the chance to meet some of the 66 artists who created the work in the exhibition.

title: Being Scene VIP Preview
summary: Join Workman Arts for an exclusive VIP preview of Being Scene 2020, featuring live entertainment, hors d’oeuvres and fabulous mocktails. Peruse over 100 artworks with the added bonus of purchasing before opening day. You’ll also get the chance to meet some of the artists who created the work in the exhibition, as well as other talented Workman Artists.

title: Invisible Footprints 0.3 Symposium
summary: The Invisible Footprints project concludes with a symposium, featuring a screening of the artists' final video projects as well as artist panels.

title: GMing Club 05: Ryuutama
summary: For folks who have always wanted to run a tabletop RPG but needed a great group, a safe space, an easy way to learn the game, or just a little encouragement, Shel Kahn is running the GMing Club, a program to help folks who want to try being a Game Master to learn a new game.

title: Tribute to Barbara Hammer
summary: Join us for a special evening celebrating the films and life of legendary film/artist Barbara Hammer (1939-2019) who left us too soon last year.

title: CFMDC AGM 2020
summary: It's that time of year again! Please save the date for the 2020 Annual General Meeting. All members are encouraged to attend.

title: How To Create a Pitch Package
summary: Pitch packages are an essential ingredient in today’s competitive film and video industry. In this workshop, participants will go over the basic elements of a pitch package, view examples and discuss design styles as well as gain a deeper understanding of how to write a logline, tagline and one-page synopsis of their project.

title: Feb Fatale 7: Presence Tense
summary: DMG's annual noir-themed game jam, set in the dead heart of winter, digs in to a new challenging theme every year. For new game makers and experienced creators alike. Registration and DMG membership is required.

title: Introduction to Blender 3D
summary: Have you wanted to make your own 3D animation? In this workshop with digital media artist and scholar, Hiba Ali, we will learn 3D animation on Blender, an open-source (free) 3D animation program. We will animate 3D text, key frame 3D shapes, add colour and texture and make our own 3D animation video. Previous video-editing or animation experience is not required.

title: VRARA Meetup
summary: Join the monthly VRARA Toronto Chapter meeting to network & learn about the Toronto VR/AR industry & ecosystem.

title: VRARA Meetup
summary: Join the monthly VRARA Toronto Chapter meeting to network & learn about the Toronto VR/AR industry & ecosystem.

title: VR Studio Night
summary: Have a brilliant VR idea? Want to build a prototype in a beginner-friendly, supportive environment? Need some extra guidance and encouragement?

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: February Speaker Social
summary: DMG's regular speaker social! Every month, folks working in games, on game-related projects, or in interactive arts give a brief presentation on their work. This month, Roya DelSol, Rui Jie Wang, and others present creative work in volumetric video and interactive 360 WebVR.

title: Textile Game Controllers Jam Info Session
summary: Attending the Textile Game Controllers Jam? Join this info session, where you’ll get a quick overview/review of the e-textiles techniques covered in the previous workshops, an opportunity to introduce yourself and meet fellow jammers, and start scheming about what you’d like to build during the jam.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: Reflections of a Real-Life Feminist Killjoy
summary: Can we pay attention to generational anger as a recurrent sign of shifts in feminist thinking? Join EMILIA-AMALIA for a second look at the second wave with a screening of "Jill Johnston: October 1975" (1977) and an out-loud reading group that discusses Kyla Wazana Tompkins’s essay, "Reflections of a Real-Life Feminist Killjoy: Ball-Busters and the Recurring Trauma of Intergenerational Queer-Feminist Life” published in Inside Killjoy's Kastle: Dykey Ghosts, Feminist Monsters, and Other Lesbian Hauntings (2019).

title: Field Recordings
summary: In this workshop, participants will learn key ways that sound artists who rely on field recordings integrate them into their practice.

title: 360 Degree Video Primer
summary: Have you ever wondered what 360 perspective looks like? Learn how to shoot, stitch, and edit with 360 Theta camera.

title: Cinematography Theory and Practice Pt. 1
summary: With hands-on instruction, get a solid background on the importance of cinematography theory and practice, covering lighting, camera techniques and exposure. Learn how to develop an overall original look for a motion picture, whether documentary or feature.

title: Cinematography Theory and Practice Pt. 2
summary: With hands-on instruction, get a solid background on the importance of cinematography theory and practice, covering lighting, camera techniques and exposure. Learn how to develop an overall original look for a motion picture, whether documentary or feature.

title: Directing Dramatic Film
summary: Geared towards new directors, this innovative, fast-paced workshop covers script breakdown, shot lists, pre-production, locations, camera placement, post-production, and working with a crew and a producer.

title: Crowdfunding for Film
summary: This hands-on workshop will teach you the fundamentals of crowdfunding and how to plan, film and launch your own crowdfunding campaign.

title: Grant Writing Lab
summary: This interactive workshop will provide media artists with the tools and resources to prepare a clear and concise grant application for their individual projects.

summary: Friends Play Games (formerly Games With Friends) is our monthly, inclusive, free and open to the public game playing event at Gamma Space's new home in the Toronto Media Arts Centre!

title: Love My Dysfunctions Opening Reception
summary: LOVE MY DYSFUNCTIONS by Rebecca Sweets is an immersive installation which explores her mad, neurodivergent + disabled identity through the lens of executive dysfunction, a dominant symptom of ADHD. Presented by the Margin of Eras Gallery, in collaboration with Charles Street Video.

title: Colour Theory Round 5: 2SQT + BIPOC Short Film Night
summary: A program of short  films exclusively created by 2S / Queer / Trans + Black, Indigenous, people of colour.

title: Friends Play Games
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Unarmed Verses
summary: Join us for a screening of "Unarmed Verses" presented by Black Futures Now and NFB, followed by a panel discussion about the film.

title: Origin Stories Opening Reception
summary: Join DMG and participating artists for the opening reception of ORIGIN STORIES.

title: Public Speaking 101
summary: Interested in speaking at conferences, but nervous about public speaking? Or do you enjoy giving presentations, but want to find ways to feel more comfortable on stage? This is the workshop for you.

title: DMG × Black Women Film! VR Camp
summary: This exciting VR intensive program is aimed at introducing a small group of participants to the process of creating interactive virtual reality experiences using 360-degree volumetric video.

title: Arts Ahead 2020: Transforming Tomorrow
summary: An annual one-day symposium for arts professionals and cultural leaders from organizations across Ontario. Arts Ahead aims to inspire attendees to change their perspectives on how they make art or manage an arts organization in order to adapt to the current political, social, and environmental culture.

title: Toronto Media Arts Roundtable
summary: MANO and Critical Distance are partnering to frame the conversation on the responsibilities and pressures for artist-run and media art organizations and collectives, along with staff and contractors for the production of historical records. This is a free event and all artists and arts workers are welcome to join.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: Friends Play Games
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: Barbara Laronde Award Artists Talk
summary: Hear the artists part of the exhibition speak about their work and answer questions.

title: Barbara Laronde Award Exhibition Opening
summary: Join Native Women in the Arts for the opening of the exhibition along with the presentation of the 5th Annual Barbara Laronde Award to winner Joe Wood, with a performance by Melody McKiver, with a catered reception and bar, and beats by DJ Jams, as part of the Inaabandam Symposium. This is a FREE event and all are welcome.

title: QGCarnival
summary: An all-ages local-fair style fundraiser for the Queerness and Games Conference.

title: Textile Game Controllers: Fun with Felting
summary: Learn to make a game controller from sheep wool and conductive fiber in this hands-on workshop. All materials provided, and no experience necessary.

title: Transformation Stories
summary: Come out and celebrate Black creatives as they share their journeys and transform their stories! You can expect beautiful artwork, deep conversations about mental wellness, healing and growth, free food and good vibes.

title: Blanket Toss Under Midnight Sun: A Visual Presentation
summary: *Blanket Toss Under Midnight Sun* is a revelatory portrait of eight Indigenous communities that is both an invaluable historical record, and a meaningful act of reclamation, showing the ongoing resilience of Indigenous communities – past, present and future. Join writer Paul Seesequasis for a visual tour of the book and the stories behind many of the photos.

title: Moment Variations Reception
summary: Join Charles Street Video for a reception for Nick Fox-Gieg and Meagan Williams' _Moment Variations_.

title: Screening and Talk with Alice Ming Wai Jim: Trying Angles
summary: Join us for a talk and film screening by Alice Ming Wai Jim in collaboration with the Canadian Filmmakers Distribution Centre (CFMDC). Inviting artists and curators to respond to E-A's programming, and to the CFMDC film collection, these ongoing curated screenings activate holes, gaps and omissions as strategies for intergenerational knowledge transmission, political resistance and feminist praxis.

title: Directing Documentary
summary: This lecture-based course aims to guide participants through the fundamental steps of directing documentary.

title: Efficient Editing for Premiere Pro
summary: This workshop will aim to increase the efficiency of your editing in Premiere Pro. It is best suited for those just starting out in editing (1-2 years of experience or less) and want to make their workflow more efficient using different tools and keyboard shortcuts.

title: The Reverie Project Reception
summary: The artist will be in attendance for The Reverie Project's reception. In its North American premiere, this multi-channel video installation offers an intimate encounter with a migrant community in Geneva, Switzerland—a city that is also home of the 1951 Refugee Convention, the international treaty that defines who a refugee is and sets out the responsibilities of nations that grant asylum.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: Stitch & Stuff: Making Sewable Games
summary: In this workshop, we will learn how to make a hardware-only game using a microcontroller and electronic components. We will use electronic textile materials and soft circuit techniques to create a fully working Simon-style game. These games will be yours to take home at the end of the workshop!

title: Game Workers: Know Your Rights
summary: Join Game Workers Unite Toronto for a discussion with a labour lawyer on your rights in the workplace.

title: Friends Play Games
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Unity for Absolute Beginners - Part 2
summary: Learn Unity from scratch in this two-part class for absolute beginners!

title: Unity for Absolute Beginners - Part 1
summary: Learn Unity from scratch in this two-part class for absolute beginners!

title: DMG Annual General Meeting
summary: Attend the DMG annual member meeting for insight and input into operations, finances, and plans for the future.

title: Game Writers Circle + Social
summary: Join other game writers and narrative designers for a cozy get together every month!

title: Game Writers Circle + Social
summary: Join other game writers and narrative designers for a cozy get together every month!

title: CSV Holiday Video Chuck 2019!
summary: Charles Street Video is having a holiday party! Join us for oysters and a screening of our members' work!

title: Low Poly 3D Modeling with Blender 2.8 – Part 2
summary: Love the look of low-poly? Want to get started with making 3D art for games in a supportive, artist-centered environment? Honking pumped to make the next Untitled Goose Game? Join DMG for a two-part hands-on workshop and learn from artist Kaitlyn Dougon!

title: Low Poly 3D Modeling with Blender 2.8 – Part 1
summary: Love the look of low-poly? Want to get started with making 3D art for games in a supportive, artist-centered environment? Honking pumped to make the next Untitled Goose Game? Join DMG for a two-part hands-on workshop and learn from artist Kaitlyn Dougon!

title: November Speaker Social
summary: On the 2nd Saturday of the month, folks working in games, on game-related projects, or in interactive arts give a brief presentation on their work. Expect fascinating insights into a broad range of disciplines, introductions to rad projects and tools, interesting creators and new friends!

title: Intro to Tabletop Roleplaying Games
summary: From Dungeons and Dragons to The Fall of Magic – an overview and exploration of tabletop roleplaying games as a medium.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: Inaabandam Symposium
summary: The Inaabandam symposium will foreground issues of concern and interest to Indigenous Women and Gender Marginalized artists from multiple disciplines including film, performing arts, visual art, and customary practices.

title: Queers & More Queers Game Night
summary: A bi-monthly game night that welcomes trans, non-binary, femmes, women and any queer-identified folk.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: Gathering Across Moana Reception
summary: Join GLAM Collective, in partnership with imagineNATIVE Film + Media Arts Festival, Trinity Square Video, A Space Gallery, and CFMDC, for a closing reception for the Gathering Across Moana exhibition.

title: RUDE Talks: Podcast Creation
summary:
Have you been interested in launching an independent podcast but don't know how or where to start? We want to share DIY tools for recording, interviewing and establishing your own podcast, hosted by Queer, Black & Awkward podcast runner, Orion Mayas. 

This workshop goes over the fundamentals of running an independent podcast such as establishing a show format, interview tips, owning your RSS feed, marketing and equipment basics. Plus, we’ll have equipment available for you to experiment with, and record a sample introduction to your podcast!

title: RUDE Talks: Rap Songwriting
summary: What’s your story? Join myst milano. for a 4 hour workshop teaching you the ins and outs of rapping, from lyricism and flow to marketing and live performance. Learn the fundamentals of what it takes to be a great rapper.

title: Bodies Borders Fields Symposium
summary: Convened by Denise Ryner in collaboration with Yaniya Lee, Bodies Borders Fields is a free public symposium that re-imagines a 1967 conversation about blackness to generate a larger discourse for the contemporary moment around blackness and fugitivity as represented in critical art practices today.

title: Involution
summary: At the time of year when the veil between the living and dead is the thinnest, this program presents an experience of motherhood as a shifting of boundaries between the Self and an Other. Time and space fracture and become contaminated. Bodies multiply and decay, mothers are remembered; they are squeezed and wrung out. Worlds are destroyed and remade for speculative future inhabitants, whether zombies, queens, vampires, monsters or babies. Featuring works by Helen Benigson, Hanna Black, Leigh Bowery, Thirza Cuthand, Catherine Elwes, Edward Owens, Corin Sworn, and Leslie Thornton.

title: October Social
summary: On the 2nd Saturday of the month, folks working in games, on game-related projects, or in interactive arts give a brief presentation on their work. Expect fascinating insights into a broad range of disciplines, introductions to rad projects and tools, interesting creators and new friends!

title: I can better explain this way Opening Reception
summary: Celebrate the photography and animation projects youth in MANY have been working on since July. It will be a night of art, food, and fun activities!

title: Arts Futures 2019: Immersive Technology as an Artistic Medium
summary: Virtual reality offers tremendous potential for the creation of artistic works and narratives. This program will help artists and digital producers across all disciplines take advantage of the opportunities for storytelling and audience engagement offered by immersive technology.

title: Writing Text-Based Horror Games
summary: Just in time for spooky season, Kaitlin Tremblay and Natalie Zina Walschots will take workshop participants through the riches of text-based horror and the genre's great potential to scare the crap out of players. Participants will learn from some of the best examples of the genre, and will be introduced to the structure of text-based horror and led through the process of creating text-based horror games.

title: Intro to Typography for Indie Games
summary: Selecting typefaces thoughtfully can have a profound effect on the strength of your art direction and improve the usability and accessibility of your interface. In this info-packed lecture, designer Nate Davis will demystify typography and typesetting for games – and more!

title: 2SQTBIPoC Arts & Zine Fair!
summary: The Non-Binary Colour Collective hosts its second arts & zine fair focused on two-spirit, queer and trans artists that are Black, Indigenous, and/or people of colour! Allies are welcome to come and support vendors by purchasing their work.

title: Wearable Game Controllers: Halloween Edition
summary: Want to make wearable game controllers that can be played with your friends? How about vampire capes, witches' hats, and zombie bandages as game interfaces? In this workshop, you will learn to design and make multiplayer wearable game controllers.

title: Bringing Your Authentic Self to Your Writing
summary: Bilal Baig guides participants through activities to inspire writing and creation from a personal lens. Bilal focuses on creating new text that is based in authentic and honest experience. Participants will work through activities to generate new text.

title: Haunted Homecoming
summary: Join DMG for an evening of multiple Monster Hearts games converging for a final homecoming social. All the high school drama and heartbreak at your command – but with safety tools and quiet space to decompress.

title: Assistant Editing Pt. 1
summary: Working alongside the editor, the assistant editor plays an essential role in the post-production phase while simultaneously gaining valuable theoretical, technical and profession insight into picture editing. Join this workshop to learn the essentials of preparing a project professionally for offline and online edits.

title: Creative Freelancing Pt. 1
summary: If you’re a freelance image creator (videographer, photographer, or similar) or you’re interested in becoming one, this 2-part workshop will give you the tools you need to make a living and find clients who will keep asking you back.

title: Directing Actors Pt. 1
summary: This workshop will provide fundamentals on working with non-professional to experienced actors in both scripted and improvised scenes.

title: Writing Satire
summary: Want to write satirical news in the style of The Onion, The Beaverton or Walking Eagle News? In this workshop, recovering journalist Tim Fontaine will teach you how to write hilarious (or cringe-inducing) short articles and headlines that grab people's attention.

title: VR Installation
summary: Create a basic VR environment for users to explore. Participants will learn the Unity3D interface; objects, sprites and texture mapping; physics; basic scripting; and exporting for distribution and exhibition.

title: How to Write a Pitch
summary: You've been working on great film - now you have to convince others to fund it. This workshop will unpack the art of a good pitch including its essential elements and how to connect with your audience. Bring a your film ideas and get ready to turn them into a pitch!

title: Directing Actors Pt. 2
summary: This workshop will provide fundamentals on working with non-professional to experienced actors in both scripted and improvised scenes.

title: Assistant Editing Pt. 2
summary: Working alongside the editor, the assistant editor plays an essential role in the post-production phase while simultaneously gaining valuable theoretical, technical and profession insight into picture editing. Join this workshop to learn the essentials of preparing a project professionally for offline and online edits.

title: Creative Freelancing Pt. 2
summary: If you’re a freelance image creator (videographer, photographer, or similar) or you’re interested in becoming one, this 2-part workshop will give you the tools you need to make a living and find clients who will keep asking you back.

title: Tabletop Game Night 04: Dungeon World
summary: Old and new players are invited to join our new game masters for a one-shot session of Dungeon World! Roll dice, make characters, face challenges and tell an awesome story in an evening of roleplaying.

title: GMing Club 04: Dungeon World
summary: For folks who have always wanted to run a tabletop RPG but needed a great group, a safe space, an easy way to learn the game, or just a little encouragement, DMG hosts GMing Club, a program to help folks who want to try being a Game Master to learn a new game with Shel Kahn.

title: Making Mad Artist Panel
summary: Join Workman Arts for an artist talk/panel featuring creators whose work is featured in the Making Mad exhibition, on at TMAC as part of the Rendezvous With Madness Festival through October 20.

title: Making Mad Opening Reception
summary: Join Workman Arts for the opening reception of Making Mad, a visual and interactive art exhibition part of the Rendezvous With Madness Festival.

title: Mystique Afrique 2019
summary: Ayiba Magazine is pleased to announce its second annual celebration of African music, art, fashion, and culture: Mystique Afrique in Toronto. This year, our multisensorial event is curated to give guests a taste and feel for what the black creative community in Toronto has to offer.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: The Hair Scarf Project Opening Reception
summary: Monica Mak (documentary filmmaker) and Shiva Shoeybi (mixed media artist) have joined forces to create The Hair Project. This collaborative mixed media work combines fabric-based art with documentary video installation. Through the fusion of these media forms, we reflect on the internal versus external constructions of female appearance, the lived experiences of three Muslim women of different ages and backgrounds, who choose to wear.

title: Building Bridges in Grassroots Arts
summary:
Join Wavelength Music Series for this animated discussion at Toronto Media Arts Centre regarding bridge-building for communities in the DIY/grassroots/underground space. 

In an interconnected world increasingly dominated by a handful of powerful media and social media companies, what does it mean to be a grassroots or niche organization? Can you still have an impact and make a difference? Is bridge-building the key to how grassroots communities and organizations survive and thrive?

title: Friends Play Games
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Talking Back Feminist Media Conference
summary: In celebration of our 15th year of independent feminist publishing for teens, Shameless will host the first ever Talking Back Feminist Media Conference.

title: Queers & More Queers Game Night
summary: A bi-monthly game night that welcomes trans, non-binary, femmes, women and any queer-identified folk.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: Lighting on a Budget
summary: This workshop will cover the basic safety procedures when working with lights, and utilizing a basic tungsten light kit, and a basic LED light kit to its highest potential. Participants will experiment and become familiarized with DIY materials that can be used to modify and play with light in interesting and cinematic ways. This workshop will use materials and equipment all under $150.

title: Walk a Mile in My Moccasins
summary: Curated by Adrienne Huard, "Walk a Mile in My Moccasins (Then Slide Them Off and Come Lay With Me)" is a program featuring a film and a video project that engage the intersections of Two-Spirit identity, queerness, Indigenous feminism, gender expression and sexual autonomy. In "Positions" (2018) by Justin Ducharme and "Honey Moccasin" (1998) by Shelley Niro, perspectives on queerness, tradition and Indigenous understandings of gender playfully expand on Two-Spirit representations. These films normalize Indigenous experiences and subvert the settler colonial gaze.

title: BUMP TV Fund Run Spectacular
summary: A live telethon to support our friends at BUMP TV! Three teams of Toronto art-world "Mega Celebrities" will compete in an elite green screen marathon, LIVE LIVE LIVE on BUMP TV.

title: Making Sense Opening Reception
summary: CFMDC and SKETCH Working Arts invite you to the opening of an exhibition of experimental works focused on game design, VR, and video works integrating media arts! This exhibition is thematically underscored by the idea that artists know by doing and feeling,  learn by doing, and attempting to make sense of their senses.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: Resonant Bodies Opening Reception
summary: Resonant Bodies is an exhibition about the sonic reflections between bodies and their environments. Aspects of these works will be performed live by the artists at the exhibition opening.

title: Broadcasting Play: A Panel on Podcasting and Streaming RPGs
summary: Join local RPG streamers and podcasters as they discuss the shift of tabletop gaming to the public realm, and how the worlds of theatre and gaming are colliding to create new forms of performance and play.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: On-Screen Protocols & Pathways
summary: This all-day workshop has been specially designed to help companies in the digital and interactive field utilize "On-Screen Protocols and Pathways: A Media Production Guide to Working with First Nations, Métis and Inuit Communities, Cultures, Concepts and Stories" in a meaningful way. Learn with imagineNATIVE staff why Indigenous protocols are vitally important, and how the incorporation of the protocols can lead your company to greater creative and artistic heights.

title: Volumetric Video for Film and Media Artists
summary: Almost 10 years after the release of the Kinect, plenty of inexpensive hardware exists for shooting volumetric video – what’s still lacking are practical editing and compositing workflows for live-action filmmakers, and that's what we'll be exploring here.

title: Friends Play Games #131
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Digital Workflow and Data Management Pt. 1
summary: This workshop offers insight into file-based production, data management and workflow options for people who use tapeless media on the front line.

title: Colour Theory: a 2S + queer + trans + BIPOC short film night
summary: Celebrate 2S / Queer / Trans + Black, Indigenous, people of colour filmmakers by catching some free short films! Please note this is a space that prioritizes BIPOC and 2SLGBTQQIA people.

title: Scriptwriting Fundamentals: The Short Screenplay Pt. 2
summary: In this workshop, participants will learn the fundamentals of narrative screenwriting, including character, structure and image. Using these tools and through class discussion and screenings, participants will begin the process of unlocking their ideas and turning them into structured and dynamic screenplays. Participants must bring an idea to the workshop that they will develop during the course. No experience necessary.

title: Remaking Game Work Public Forum
summary: Join us at a public forum with game developers, media work researchers, and digital labour activists to discuss working conditions and social inequalities in the video games industry and strategies to improve conditions in digital media.

title: Shooting on a Budget
summary: A 3 hour workshop on DIY and low-budget cinematography, camera techniques, and work ethic among minimal crews. Explore how low budget cinematographers can embrace DIY aesthetics and equipment as a stylistic advantage to support their films.

title: Grant Writing Essentials
summary: This introductory workshop will demystify the grant writing process for media artists seeking funding to support for their projects in film, video, audio, digital and/or new media.

title: International Visiting Artists: Liina Kuittinen (Finland)
summary: A new performance by Liina Kuittinen (Finland) will be presented as part of the the International Visiting Artists program by FADO Performance Art and VIVA! Art Action.

title: Liina Kuittinen & Marita Bullmann
summary: Artist talk with presented by FADO, with Liina Kuittinen (Finland) and Marita Bullman (Germany) as part of the the International Visiting Artists series. The artists will speak about their own practices and the contemporary performance art ecologies of their home cities/countries.

title: International Visiting Artists: Marita Bullmann (Germany)
summary: Marita Bullmann's works are engagements with everyday objects: familiar materials, actions, spaces and places. In her performances, she seeks a direct encounter between body and space. Presented by FADO Performance Art in collaboration with VIVA! Art Action.

title: Post Production Toolkit for Emerging Producers
summary: This workshop will serve as an introduction to post production for emerging film producers, with a focus on post supervision. Covering post-production workflow, working with offline and online editors, finishing and delivery. Participants are encouraged to come with questions.

title: Post Production Toolkit for Emerging Directors
summary: This workshop will serve as an introduction to post production for emerging film directors, from development to delivery and covering storyboarding, the director-editor relationship, and post workflow. Participants are encouraged to come with questions.

title: Content Creation with Video Synthesis Pt. 2
summary: In this workshop we will experiment with Lumen and the Syphon protocol as tools for creating and recording synthesized video content.

title: Content Creation with Video Synthesis
summary: In this workshop we will experiment with Lumen and the Syphon protocol as tools for creating and recording synthesized video content.

title: Colour Theory for Film and Video
summary: Using examples from film and video, this workshop will explore the effects of colour on the viewer, and how treatments and manipulation are used in the industry.

title: Digital Workflow and Data Management Pt. 2
summary: This workshop offers insight into file-based production, data management and workflow options for people who use tapeless media on the front line.

title: Pin + Patch Show
summary: The Pin + Patch Show is back for another show featuring dozens of pin and patch vendors from Toronto, across Canada, and around the world!

title: Still Life with a Suitcase Opening Reception
summary: Join us for the opening reception for Still Life with a Suitcase, an interactive cinematic installation about transnational Russian migration as told through objects, where the audience determines how the story unfolds.

title: Intro to Projection Mapping
summary: Learn to use Isadora to projection map your video, animation, or images onto 3D physical objects and even learn how to incorporate live interactivity into your installation.

title: Home Made Visible
summary: Celebrate the opening of the Home Made Visible Tour's closing event.

title: Scriptwriting Fundamentals: The Short Screenplay Pt. 1
summary: In this workshop, participants will learn the fundamentals of narrative screenwriting, including character, structure and image. Using these tools and through class discussion and screenings, participants will begin the process of unlocking their ideas and turning them into structured and dynamic screenplays. Participants must bring an idea to the workshop that they will develop during the course. No experience necessary.

title: Projection Mapping - Light, Form & The Stage
summary: This hands-on course teaches students to customize graphical content (video, image) and then map this content on to physical 3D objects using Isadora.

title: Storytelling Game Night: “Night Forest”
summary: Join Shel Kahn for an evening spent playing Night Forest, a ritual game of candles and gentle storytelling prompts. We’ll be exploring a space together, with candles and gold-printed prompt cards – indoors or out in Lisgar Park.

title: Artist Talk: Jordan Sook
summary: Jordan Sook will speak about his work, and his first solo exhibition on now in our galleries.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club w/ Kris Maddigan
summary: A monthly breakfast-time meetup for game audio folk. This month's guest is Kristopher Maddigan, the composer of Cuphead! He'll be talking about his experiences and the Cuphead soundtrack, with the usual Q&A and discussion over coffee.

title: Shai Heredia presents Uday Shakar's Kalpana
summary: A screening with Shai Heredia, in Toronto fresh from programming the Flaherty Seminar in New York. Film TBA.

title: Armchair Politics
summary: Armchair Politics, part of CFMDC's yearlong collaboration with EMILIA-AMALIA, imagines an affective viewing space where socially encoded scripts of identity, as mediated by the screen, are challenged, negotiated and transformed. Free.

title: Back from the Future
summary: In this workshop, you will create a small art piece using personal archival photographs and/or objects based on the premise that somebody in the future will find these archives and send them back to communicate with you in the present.

title: Friends Play Games #129
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Birth, Death & the Inevitable Loss of Youth Opening Reception
summary: Join us for the opening reception of Jordan Sook's first major solo exhibition.

title: A Piece Of Me
summary: Somewherelse presents a special one-day immersive exhibition to launch international filmmaker Sara Elgamal’s latest documentary film “A Piece Of Me.”

title: Sunday Sundae Social
summary: Scoop and sprinkle ice cream with DMG for a sugar-saturated Sunday afternoon social. Join us in Lisgar Park for sweet treats and friends new and old. All are welcome.

title: Black is My Religion
summary: The event is a black-only space. A discussion, dinner, and social with a DJ and live performance. How do traditional and other faith groups talk about Blackness? How do we as Black people reconcile faith/spirituality with the effects of colonization on religion? What potential exists for unification amongst Black spiritual communities? How might we use faith as a form of resistance and radical self-care?

title: Toronto Lit Up: Meat and Bone
summary: Join Conundrum Press and the Toronto International Festival of Authors in celebrating the release of Kat Verhoeven’s Meat and Bone – a queer slice-of-life drama about dating and eating – through Toronto Lit Up!

title: Friends Play Games #128
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Free Headshots for Artists
summary: Art Starts is offering FREE headshots to artists and art workers! This is your opportunity to update your headshot for social media profiles, your website, etc.

title: simultaneities in reflexivities
summary: Curated by Calla Durose-Moya, "simultaneities in reflexivities: absence/presence ⋆ seer/seen" is a program that engages with and revisits performance-for-camera work made by women and non-binary video artists in Canada. Through a variety of methods and materials, these artists’ works demonstrate that vulnerability is not only an affective modality, but also a political statement.

title: Twenty_Four_Seven / 365 Reception
summary: Join us for a closing night reception for Aljumaine Gayle's Twenty_Four_Seven / 365. All ages welcome.

title: Queers & More Queers Game Night
summary: A bi-monthly game night that welcomes trans, non-binary, femmes, women and any queer-identified folk.

title: Game Accessibility Mini-Summit
summary: Join Gamma Space and DMG for an afternoon of fascinating and actionable talks on a variety of aspects of accessibility for video games, straight from members of our Toronto indie game dev community.

title: All or None
summary: Parkdale resident jes sasche addresses the negotiations of bodies moving in public/private space and the work of their care. Their large-scale video loop will play alongside all-or-none, a site specific installation of furniture found in Parkdale parking lots.

title: Blackout Eid: Ifrah Hussein, Faiza, Obuxum
summary: Ahay with NXNE, presents the first ever #BlackoutEid concert in Toronto featuring an all Black Muslim women lineup of artists.

title: Building BIPOC Careers in Tech: A day of Portfolio-Building & Mentorship
summary: Building BIPOC Careers in Tech is an opportunity for early-career folks who identify as Black, Indigenous, and POC to work on building or strengthening their online portfolios/resumes, and connect with experienced BIPOC individuals in the tech industry.

title: Intro to Clip Studio & Krita
summary: Learn how to make the switch from Photoshop to the more wallet-friendly illustration and digital painting tools Clip Studio and Krita.

title: Love's Secret Domain
summary: Love’s Secret Domain is an experimental live-action game with dance elements themed around the music of Coil. It follows the lives of a group of queer noise musicians and hangers-on as they contemplate love, death, and the crushing socioeconomic pressures of heteronormativity while approaching middle age.

title: Hiring Professional Voice Performers for Your Game
summary: In this info session, creators will learn to engage professional voice performers. ACTRA is the union representing performers in recorded media in Canada with 15,000 members in the GTA. Learn how to find and contract the perfect voice for your game!

title: ON-FOOT: West Queen West Tour Launch
summary: Join us to celebrate the launch of ON-FOOT, an immersive walking tour app with interactive media, AR, VR, and striking audio and visuals.

title: Tech Zines 101 Workshop
summary: This workshop will guide in you in creating a zine, specifically focusing on tech related zines. From our experiences online, to the infrastructure around us this workshop will explore the ways we can use our creative energy to build stories, how-to’s, fun guides or just a stream of thoughts on paper.

title: My Still Life Opening Reception
summary: Celebrate a new work by talented video artist Tess Payne, _My Still Life: A Tableau_, a reflection on aging, infrastructure and erasure.

title: National Youth Slam Festival
summary: A multidisciplinary festival, with arts workshops and events that people can pop in and out of throughout the day, including things outside of the field of spoken word and poetry.

title: RE: Infrastructures
summary: Our Networks 2019 explores the collective care and maintenance of alternative networking practices—new protocols, peer-to-peer connections, offline-first computing, or community-based governance and ownership.

title: Fluid
summary: A documentary on queer identity, dress and practice in Toronto. Q&A to follow with director Alysia Myette and cast members.

title: Artificial Nature: Haru Ji & Graham Wakefield
summary: Spiral Artist Talk with Haru Ji and Graham Wakefield, on their research project Artificial Nature, exploring the subject of life in art through artificial life worldmaking.

title: Our Blood
summary: A performance art piece in which the audience is invited to bear witness to live, menstruating bodies.

title: Pleasure Dome AGM
summary: Members of PLEASURE DOME are invited to the 2019 AGM.

title: Water Fall Opening Reception
summary: Please join us for the opening reception for Annette Mangaard’s *Water Fall: A Cinematic Installation*, spotlighting water as both an environmental and conceptual issue.

title: Queers & More Queers Game Night
summary: A bi-monthly game night that welcomes trans, non-binary, femmes, women and any queer-identified folk.

title: Grant-Writing Info Session for Media Artists
summary: Peter Kingstone, Visual & Media Arts Program Manager at the Toronto Arts Council, will lead a workshop and discussion about applying for project grants as a media artist.

title: May Speaker Social: Later Alligator!
summary: A special speaker social, featuring a lively Q&A with the animation and developer team behind Later Alligator.

title: Unfeeling Capitalism: Ruptures in Video Game Culture
summary: A night of talk and play with game workers, players and artists confronting capitalism, white supremacy, and misogyny in real and virtual worlds.

title: It’s Alive! Film / Form /Life
summary: An annual conference dedicated to exploring the intersections of film, media, and philosophy with a special interest in issues and themes of political resistance and aesthetic dissonance.

title: Writing Dialogue For Games
summary: Learn the fundamentals of writing dialogue for games, the different types of dialogue and how to successfully craft purposeful and effective dialogue for your projects.

title: Walk a Mile in My Shoes
summary: An event to raise awareness of gender-based violence and human trafficking in Toronto through art, music, culture and food.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: Friends Play Games #126
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Friends Play Games #127
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Open RPG Gaming Night
summary: Always wanted to try playing a roleplaying game like Dungeons and Dragons? Come enjoy a relaxed, beginner-friendly night of gaming, with DMG members facilitating and running rpgs, gm-less storytelling and worldbuilding games, and more!

title: Bit Bazaar × Toronto Tech Zine Fair
summary: Toronto’s 🎮 video game flea market + 📚 zine fair + 🌮 snack fest is back for its 10th edition. Partnering with Ones and Zeroes, we're also bringing you the first-ever Toronto Tech Zines!

title: Mural Map of Canada Edit-a-thon
summary: At this edit-a-thon, artists and members of the public can join in to add and update mural and street art info and photos to Mural Routes' newly-formatted Mural Map of Canada.

title: Netami Stuart in Conversation with Annette Mangaard
summary: A panel discussion concerning water, floodplains, wetlands, and the future of our city.

title: Artist Talk: Annette Mangaard
summary: An evening with artist Annette Mangaard (_Water Fall_), introduced by exhibition curator Carla Garnet.

title: In Conversation:  Annette Mangaard, Christopher Dewdney and Simone Jones
summary: A conversation between artists Annette Mangaard, Christopher Dewdney, and Simone Jones on how artists can use science to expose tensions proposed by representation, and strategies for making the invisible visible.

title: What the Futures? Opening Reception
summary: Check out the work of the 2019 Digital Futures grads.

title: Friends Play Games #123
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: The Writer's Circle with Thom Vernon
summary: Inspiring sessions designed to keep you writing and exploring.

title: The Writers Circle
summary: Inspiring sessions designed to keep you writing and exploring.

title: The Writer's Circle with Thom Vernon
summary: Inspiring sessions designed to keep you writing and exploring.

title: Friends Play Games #124
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: 360: Shooting, Directing, Producing
summary: An introduction to creating for the 360 video format, covering challenges in creating good immersive experiences,  production workflows and the chance to try various cameras and see the results.

title: Scriptwriting for Web Series
summary: This workshop offers aspiring writers and introduction to writing for web series in the digital age.

title: 360 Degree Video Primer
summary: An introduction to the medium of 360 video, an immersive and new technology that can used for artistic, educational, or documentary purposes.

title: Introduction to Adobe After Effects (2)
summary: A survey workshop on After Effects, covering video and animation sequences, composition, timelines, keyframes, wireframes, masking, titling and applying effects. Participants would benefit by having some knowledge of video editing and graphics applications.

title: Introduction to Adobe After Effects (1)
summary: A survey workshop on After Effects, covering video and animation sequences, composition, timelines, keyframes, wireframes, masking, titling and applying effects. Participants would benefit by having some knowledge of video editing and graphics applications.

title: Introduction to Drone Cinematography
summary: Learn how to capture the best images and footage from the most effective angles using a small-unmanned aircraft, otherwise known as a drone.

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: A monthly get-together for anyone interested in game audio and music.

title: The Weight of Inheritance
summary: Hazel Meyer revisits objects once belonging to Joyce Wieland and deemed “invaluable,” and with no archival value, prior to an exhibition premiere at The Western Front in 2020.

title: Banner-Making Workshop with Aram Han Sifuentes
summary: In the spirit of Wieland’s activism and craftwork, Sifuentes will lead a banner making workshop and help to construct a space where we can come together in solidarity through making - in and of itself, a form of resistance.

title: Yeh Freedom Life/This Freedom Life
summary: Filmed over the course of a year in a dense, working-class area in South Delhi, Priya Sen's "Yeh Freedom Life/This Freedom Life" invites us into the world of Sachi and Parveen, two women in love with other women, whose desire is to live and love outside of the constant scrutiny and sanction of society and family.

title: Brette Gabel and Allyson Mitchell in Conversation
summary: An hour long artist conversation between Brette Gabel and curator Allyson Mitchell will take place inside Gabel's new installation

title: VRTO 2019
summary: VRTO is a unique forum for philosophers, ontologists, creators, technologists, distributors and investors to come together under one roof and work towards developing a framework and process to contend with the insane pace of today’s technology.

title: Re-Joyce Opening Reception
summary: Featuring readings by Lee Maracle and Lisa Robertson.

title: MICE Collective Workshop
summary: MICE Collective looks to Joyce Weiland’s 1964 work *Peggy’s Blue Skylight* as a starting point to recreate a leisurely afternoon of friends visiting.

title: Modular Building with 3DS Max & UE4
summary: Learn the AAA pipeline of modular set building.

title: Fill in the Blank Celebration
summary: An ephemeral re-creation of the recently defunct, black-owned DIY artspace, Blank Canvas Gallery.

title: Emergence Opening Reception
summary: A special opening reception & performance for the York U AMPD Digital Media end of year show.

title: Selling and Releasing Your Finished Film
summary: In this 3-hour workshop, students get a solid foundation for understanding how various film distributors, sales agents and successful filmmakers all prepare for and engage in the nebulous act of film sales.

title: Abolitionist Dreams: Jackie Wang + Nasrin Himada in conversation
summary: EMILIA-AMALIA launches a year-long collaboration with CFMDC with two events featuring Jackie Wang.

title: Art Cart Reception featuring Mindful MCs Live
summary: Celebrate this free exhibit that showcases visual artwork created by people who access CAMH services, through the ART CART program (a partnership between Workman Arts and Gifts of Light). Mindful MCs will perform live!

title: Reason Over Passion Roundtable
summary: A roundtable discussion on Trudeaus’ policies from the White Paper of 1969 to present-day with participants Kiera Boult, Russ Diabo, Lee Maracle, and moderator Ryan McMahon.

title: Untitled
summary: Video and performance artist Thirza Cuthand presents a new hybrid moving image performance work that resists Canada's championing of resource extraction colonization through repetitious images of stock videos intercut with gestural motions of survival.

title: I Hope Today Was Worthwhile and the Weather Was Pleasant/Tracking Joyce Wieland in the Tar Sands
summary: Kirsty Robertson presents an illustrated lecture inspired by the discovery of letters Joyce Wieland wrote to Petro Canada in the early 1980s about a new body of work she planned to develop.

title: Aram Han Sifuentes and Indu Vashist in Conversation
summary: Aram Han Sifuentes will join Toronto based artist, writer, curator and activist Indu Vashist in a conversation about her work, activism in art and the current political climate.

title: Friends Play Games #122
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Intro to Arduino
summary: Join us for a hands-on introduction to Arduino, an inexpensive, flexible open-source prototyping platform for creating interactive electronic objects.

title: Killing Cyberpunk Arcade
summary: Emerge from the dead of a bad, bad winter to play cyberpunk/noir-themed games and experiences made by DMG members at the sixth annual FEB FATALE game jam, KILLING CYBERPUNK!

title: Intro to Unreal Blueprints
summary: Join us for a quick overview of Unreal Engine 4's Blueprint visual scripting system.

title: Intro to the Unreal Material Graph
summary: Join DMG for a crash-course on Unreal Engine 4's node-based material editor.

title: Friends Play Games #121
summary: Friends Play Games is a bi-weekly community gathering for everyone who loves playing, talking about and sharing their love of games! Free.

title: Building Safety, Inclusivity and Trust at the Table
summary: Interested in creating a more inclusive and safe tabletop games community? Want to learn about tools for trust you can bring to to your group? This is the talk series for you!

title: Meet the Artists & Musical Performance by Simone Schmidt
summary: Join Workman Arts for informal talks and tours of Being Scene 2019, and the chance to meet some of the exhibiting artists to hear more about their process and what informs their work.

title: The Smiling Room Opening Reception
summary: Join us for the opening reception for The Smiling Room, a multi-media dialogue about queer happiness in struggle.

title: Concept Development from Idea to Production
summary: Learn how to take an idea and get it ready for production – from brainstorming to script writing, storyboarding to pitch.

title: Intro to Blender 3D (Pt. 2)
summary: An introduction to Blender3D, a powerful open-source software application for 3D modeling and animation.

title: Intro to Unity Particles and VFX
summary: Learn the basics of working with particle systems in Unity, from the Shuriken particle system to code-driven particles and the upcoming VFX Graph.

title: Resistance / Acceptance: works that live beyond the gallery walls
summary: Sean Lee from Tangled Art + Disability will host a discussion looking at works by Claro Cosco, Paula John and claude wittmann.

title: Fashion Your Identity
summary: A queer-run and oriented conference focusing on queer accessibility in the fashion industry.

title: Being Scene Opening Reception
summary: With musical performance by James Buffin & Ann Bekooy as vocal soloist.

title: Intro to Blender 3D (Pt. 1)
summary: An introduction to Blender3D, a powerful open-source software application for 3D modeling and animation.

title: April Speaker Social
summary: Hear from DMG members about their current work in experimental games. Expect fascinating insights into a broad range of disciplines, introductions to rad projects and tools, interesting creators and new friends!

title: Breakfast Game Audio Club
summary: The Breakfast Game Audio Club is a monthly get together for anyone interested in game audio and music - happening the first Wednesday of every month at Gamma Space.

title: Grant Writing for Film and Media Artists
summary: Is your project at the point of making application to funding bodies? This course gives you the inside scoop on how to shape and fine tune your application to give it the edge it needs to be in the running.

title: Museum II Opening Reception
summary: Museum II examines trauma from war and conflict, through shared experiences across Toronto’s immigrant and refugee communities.

title: CFMDC AGM
summary: Are you a member of CFMDC? It's that time of year again! Please save the date for the 2019 Annual General Meeting.

title: Free Money Graphic Novel Launch
summary: Join us for the launch of FREE MONEY, a graphic novel story by Balkhis Hashi, Abigail Ralph and Naomi Ralph, illustrated by Janine Carrington! Reading and conversation with the authors, with special guest Eve Ewing.

title: Introduction to Adobe Premiere
summary: Learn basic techniques used in this popular non-linear editing software from setup to export. Participants are welcome to bring their own footage to work on throughout the workshop!

title: Spellbound
summary: Join TAIS for a screening featuring contemplative animated works on regenerative and healing-based rituals by lwrds duniam, Sab Meynert, Emily Pelstring, Fallon Simard, and Gabrielle Tesfaye.

title: Feb Fatale 6: Killing Cyberpunk
summary: DMG's annual noir-themed game jam, set in the dead of winter, with a cyberpunk bent. Create a small game in just a weekend!

title: Budgeting and Producing for Indie Film
summary: Make a tiny budget shine! Many incredible films, shorts, and music videos get made on a shoestring budget. Learn the basics of film budgeting, how to stay organized, tracking and managing expenses, free tools and more.

title: Queen of Hearts: Little Winter Games for Playful Hearts
summary: Five new games designed for Lisgar Park

summary: Play Games with Friends is a bi-weekly community gathering for all those that love playing, talking about, and sharing their love of games!

summary: This discussion aims to objectively quantify the parameters of these unwritten codes around collaboration, networking, knowledge/expertise, and finance.

title: Body-Centric Game Controllers
summary: Learn to create game controllers that use a part of the body.

title: Kat Singer: Unravelling Stories
summary: Join Toronto-based multimedia artist Kat Singer for an informal chat about the journey from a vague unarticulated feeling to a solid object rendered in yarn

title: Freelance Negotiations for Artists and Contractors
summary: Hey artists… find it hard to talk about money? Especially when you really need to – when negotiating a contract? This is the workshop for you!

summary: Create itty-bitty single-scene adventure games in Unity and Photoshop!

summary: Join DMG for its 6th annual GDC Offsite, featuring improv panels and talks and a very small but extremely lively afterparty.

summary: As we navigate towards “smart” cities, and more “connected” communities how do we explore what we should be worried about, what the possibilities are and how we can build towards a more just and equitable future?

title: Friends Play Games #116
summary: Play Games with Friends is a bi-weekly community gathering for all those that love playing, talking about, and sharing their love of games!

title: Tkarón:to & Turtle Island: The Remarkable Indigenous Trade Networks
summary: From corn to copper and countless resources in between, the Indigenous peoples’ relationship to land and water in Tkarón:to and on Turtle Island runs deep.

title: Wavelength Community Consultation
summary: Wavelength Music invites you to participate in a Community Consultation. This evening will be an opportunity for us to hear your feedback on our series and discuss how to create a more inclusive, supportive environment.
